article.title: Cross-symmetry breaking of two-component discrete dipolar matter-wave solitons

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about Figure 1 is FALSE?
choices: Figure 1(a) depicts a chain of two-well systems loaded with a dipolar BEC.
Figure 1(a) shows different orientations of dipoles with respect to the lattice.
Figure 1(b) illustrates the symmetric nonlocal cross-interaction.
Figure 1(b) shows the dipoles oriented by an external field at an arbitrary angle Î¸.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following correctly describes the discrete two-component solitons in Figure 2 (c) and (d)?
In Figure 3(c), what does the black curve represent in the context of cross-symmetry breaking?
choices: The stable branch of cross-symmetric solitons
The unstable branch of asymmetric solitons
The border between cross-symmetric and asymmetric solitons, marking the bifurcation points.
The critical points separating subcritical and supercritical symmetry-breaking bifurcations.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 7, what type of symmetry-breaking bifurcation is indicated by dashed lines?
